com.is2t.mwt.widgets.tiny
Class SimpleCalendar

java.lang.Object
  ej.mwt.Widget
      com.is2t.mwt.widgets.tiny.SimpleCalendar
All Implemented Interfaces:
IWidget, ej.mwt.Renderable
public class SimpleCalendar
extends ej.mwt.Widget
implements IWidget

A calendar is a widget that permit to navigate in the days. It display all the days of the current month, week by week. The navigation is done month by month.

Constant Field Values
Constructor Detail

SimpleCalendar

public SimpleCalendar()
Creates a new calendar. The current month is displayed. Equivalent to #Calendar(Date) passing System.currentTimeMillis() as argument.

SimpleCalendar

public SimpleCalendar(java.util.Date date)
Creates a new calendar. The month of the given date is displayed.
A calendar is enabled by default.

Parameters:
date - the reference date of the calendar

handleEvent

public boolean handleEvent(int event)
The calendar consume Command.UP, Command.DOWN, Command.LEFT, Command.RIGHT except on the bounds and Command.SELECT commands.

Specified by:
handleEvent in interface ej.mwt.Renderable
Overrides:
handleEvent in class ej.mwt.Widget
Parameters:
event - the event to handle
Returns:
true if the calendar has consumed the event, false otherwise
